text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

I want you all to
imagine yourself

walking into a hospital
in a low resource setting.

You are given this, and asked to
manually ventilate your child.

This is what I experienced
first-hand when I manually

ventilated my friend's
2-year-old son, Bilal,
for three days.
Unfortunately, it wasn't enough.

His lungs ruptured,
and he passed away.

Globally, respiratory
disease is one

of 33 leading causes of death
in over 60 developing countries

where there's a critical
shortage of lifesaving
equipment, like ventilators.

In particular, in Pakistan there
are less than 2,000 ventilators

for a population of
210 million people.

To address this problem, we
have built a low cost, accurate,

and portable system that
delivers consistent air
and oxygen to the patient.

This patent-pending device
addresses 90% of demand

by focusing on the
four core functions

of a traditional ventilator,
at just 10% of the price.

We have received support
from several key players,

such as the Federal Minister
of Health in Pakistan,

who will help facilitate
the launch of this device
across the country.

Let's imagine a future
where a child like Bilal

is admitted to the hospital
with a respirative condition.

With Umbulizer, he now
receives proper ventilation
and survives.

The bottom line is that this
device has the potential

to save thousands of lives and
millions of dollars in health
care spending each year.
Thank you.
[APPLAUSE]
